refnamediv.refpurpose: A step for deleting documents from the runtime cache

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: XML Calabash maintains a cache of documents. If a step attempts to load a URI, and that URI is present in the cache, the cached value will always be returned. Some steps use the cache implicitly (for example, the validate steps update it to hold schema documents).

A pipeline can remove a document from the cache explicitly with cx:cache-delete. If the href option is provided, it is used as the URI for caching, otherwise the source document URI is used. It is a dynamic error if the source document does not have a base URI and the href option is not provided.

Irrespective of the cache URI, the step simply copies it’s source document to the result port. (It does not change the document’s base URI, even if an href option is provided to the cx:cache-add step.

para.error: It is a dynamic error if the fail-if-not-in-cache option is true and the cache does not contains a document with the URI being cached.

listitem.para: The URI to cache. Defaults to the source document URI.
Determines whether the URI must already exist in the cache.
